headline: Software Engineer @ GEICO Tech
about: ðŸ‘‹ Hi! I'm a software engineer with key experience in site reliability, tech consulting, machine learning, and data science. I graduated Vanderbilt University cum laude with degrees in computer science and economics, combining technical depth with analytical problem-solving. I'm an avid snowboarder, a casual tennis player, and a sci-fi geek.

cards.title: Software Engineer, GEICO Tech
cards.description: Led a major migration from a third-party analytics tool to an in-house observability platform using Grafanaâ€™s LGTM stack, saving $12M annually. Built custom exporters in Python, closed visibility gaps, and created a React app for executive SLO monitoring and decision-making.

cards.title: Vanderbilt University
cards.description:
Cum laude, Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Bachelor of Arts in Economics.
Minor in Data Science.
GPA: 3.9/4.0

cards.title: Universal Lesion Segmentation with Transformers
cards.description: Led a comparative study of state-of-the-art segmentation models (nnUNetv2, SwinUNet, DeepLabV3+, Medical Transformer, TransUNet) for 3D lesion segmentation across diverse tissue types. Identified TransUNet as the most robust candidate, achieving a Dice score of 0.87 on bone lesions. Tackled challenges with overfitting, memory constraints, and model generalization using data augmentation, architecture adaptation, and performance diagnostics.

cards.title: Peer-to-Peer Encyrpted Chat
cards.description: Developed file transfer and input validation features for a Python-based P2P chat system over TCP. Each peer operates as both client and server, with symmetric encryption securing communication. Validated on Mininet to simulate network conditions. Included a lightweight JS/SASS frontend for user interaction.

cards.title: Projects and Proficiency: Effects of PWA
cards.description: Authored an empirical research paper analyzing how Public Works Administration (PWA) spending affected long-term occupational skill levels and income in the U.S. construction industry. Linked 1930â€“1940 census microdata and county-level spending records to estimate treatment effects via interaction models with demographic and employment controls. Found construction workers' skill outcomes were largely stable, with slight positive shifts in skill ranking and income due to PWA investment.

cards.title: Voter Registration System
cards.description: Implemented a MVP web application for managing voter registration data using PHP and MySQL. Designed and implemented a normalized relational database with support for ACID-compliant transactions and secure query handling through views, stored procedures, triggers, and transactions. Connected a PHP frontend that allows users to register, update, query, and analyze voter registration data.

cards.title: VandyHacks Design Board
cards.description: Led design efforts for multiple high-visibility assets, including Vanderbilt University's ninth and tenth annual hackathon websites, a cross-year mobile site, and on-site event installations. Collaborated with marketing and partner student groups to consistently increase hackathon participation by the hundreds.

cards.title: Tech Associate, Accenture
cards.description: Led the end-to-end development of an internal website to showcase Operations Studio services, collaborating with stakeholders to ensure alignment and boost engagement. Contributed to strategic hackathon proposals to inspire client-aligned AI solutions under tight deadlines. Designed interactive visuals for client presentations, helping secure major long-term partnerships.

cards.title: News Scraper for Media Trend Analysis
cards.description: Created a Python package that uses Selenium and robust scraping logic to automate web browsing and scrape article content from a variety of news sites. The package is designed to be easily extensible, allowing users to add new sites and customize scraping behavior. Includes a command-line interface for easy use and can be integrated into larger data analysis pipelines.

cards.title: Sales Forecasting with Time Series Machine Learning
cards.description: Built a time series forecasting model to predict daily product-level sales across 56 stores using multivariate data from a Kaggle competition. Merged and cleaned disparate datasets, imputing missing values via LOESS. Engineered temporal and categorical features to capture weekly seasonality and promotion effects. Explored scalable modeling across store-product pairs and evaluated extensions like PCA and RNNs.

cards.title: ScuffedFish: A Minimax & Alpha-Beta Pruning Chess AI
cards.description: Implemented a custom JavaScript chess engine using minimax and alpha-beta pruning AI techniques. Evaluated the performance of different utility functions in an analytical report. Determined that the addition of positional utility increases engine performance as well as the occurrence of standard, player-like chess openings.

cards.title: Explaining Species Endangerment Through Network Analysis
cards.description: Examined the correlations between species endangerment levels and various network metrics using large-scale datasets from the IUCN RedList API and studies of the Greater Antillean coral reef. Case study uses network analysis to highlight the greater endangerment level of species with high node distance from producer species.

cards.title: Software Engineer Intern, Amador Bioscience
cards.description: Led a team of three interns in the full-stack development of an internal analysis tool using R Shiny and C++, streamlining the production of tables, listings, and figures to boost operational efficiency. Designed and developed a user-friendly web interface for customizable analyses. Established foundational unit testing and documentation standards to support long-term maintainability and future development.

cards.title: California Housing Price Prediction
cards.description: Performed statistical modeling in R to predict median house values using 1990 California Census data. Conducted exploratory analysis and built linear and polynomial regression models with stepwise feature selection. Determined that a multilinear regression model using a small combination of occupant, neighborhood, and geographical factors (e.g., income, ocean proximity) is effective at predicting house values with 92.5% of predictions within one standard deviation of actual values.

cards.title: Digital Systems Teaching Assistant, Vanderbilt University
cards.description: Mentored 85 students in logic circuits, state machines, and assembly programming. Facilitated the transition to an online Q&A platform by providing ongoing support and communication, improving engagement in the hybrid course setting. Assisted professor with grading homework and exams. Standardized scoring and refined answer keys for future use.

cards.title: Machine Learning Research Intern, Amador Bioscience
cards.description: Developed machine learning models in R, including random forest and XGBoost, to analyze the relationship between drug efficacy and subject characteristics. Identified key predictive features and presented insights to executive leadership to inform strategic planning and guide future research priorities.

cards.title: Vanderbilt Robotics
cards.description: Assisted the implementation of robot vision for the Vanderbilt Robotics Camera Sub-team and worked on Vanderbilt's robot entry to the NASA Lunabotics Competition.

cards.title: An Insight into China's Investments in Kenya, Yale Young Global Scholars
cards.description: Conducted and presented a case study on China-Kenya relations and the influence of foreign aid on state sovereignty. Highlighted the expanding economic influence of China upon third-world countries and its cultural, political, and long-term impact.

cards.title: What's Your Beef: The Effect of Visual Representation on Framing, SQRI
cards.description: Conducted during the Carleton College Summer Quantitative Reasoning Institute. Led a student behavioral economics team to analyze psychological framing from product packaging. Conducted an Amazon MTurk experiment on consumer ratings and a 2-by-3 analysis of variance.
